Information: Scottish country clothing specialists the House of Bruar enjoy a unique reputation for quality that extends throughout our clothing, produce and art collections.
Review Text: Having placed my first order with The House of Bruar I was excited to receive 8 different special cheeses and some Italian Salami for our family Christmas celebrations. The welcome letter from Mark Birkbeck in the huge box was a lovely touch, especially saying "we hope your order exceeds your expectations' - sadly, however, it didn't, because on opening the huge box and going through the copious amounts of chilled-food-packaging, all I found inside was one piece of cheese from an order of 9 items. How on earth does this happen? The box was big enough for all items. The packaging suitable for all items, and even the order receipt found with the welcome letter detailed ALL the items that clearly should have been in the package. Yet 8 items were missing, and the box sealed and shipped. How can anyone package that up thinking that all the items were inside? It's astonishing. All customer service did was refund the order. As a result we are left without our special cheese for Christmas, which may not seem like a big deal to some, but it is for us.

Information: Scottish country clothing specialists the House of Bruar enjoy a unique reputation for quality that extends throughout our clothing, produce and art collections.
Review Text: The House of Bruar, I had 4 gift vouchers for my birthday and Christmas from family. I thought great I will get myself some new clothes using these vouchers but things have not gone smoothly. First if you want to use more than one voucher the system cannot cope. If I used each voucher separately it would have meant nearly £5 postage on each order. So I phoned through to place my order. You would have thought their system would allow them to pick up your basket and complete your order but no, it all had to be input again. This meant that one of the items that I wanted was now out of stock, so I chose another colour, placed my order and was told that I would receive an email with my delivery confirmation. When I came off the phone it dawned on me that because that item was in my basket that was probably why it was out of stock, so I deleted everything except that one item and hey presto it was in stock. I decided that as I really wanted this item I would place a separate order online. The next day I hadn’t received the confirmation of my order so called to check that everything was ok. I was told it was but CS had to do something to complete my order. The following day I phoned again and was told the same thing, and that it was because they needed to check my vouchers. Today day 3 I still haven’t had a confirmation but I have received the order that I placed after the original order. I obviously won’t get anything now till at least Monday and there’s a very strong possibility that I won’t get the order in time for when I need it, before Wednesday. I don’t know what to do now because if it doesn’t arrive before Wednesday I don’t want it but in addition after this total fiasco I now feel that I don’t want to have an order at all. I am so disappointed ☹️ I have said about the urgency but no one takes any notice. The vouchers totalled £190 which I understand they don’t want to lose that amount if the vouchers were fraudulent but they are not and with the lack of customer service and inconvenience caused they are going to lose more than that from my lost custom.

Review Title: I’ve thought long and hard about this…
Information: Scottish country clothing specialists the House of Bruar enjoy a unique reputation for quality that extends throughout our clothing, produce and art collections.
Review Text: I’ve thought long and hard about this feedback. Having spent over £1000 online, over four orders in the weeks pre Christmas, I think I am now qualified to compare and contrast.No 1. I only realised that returns are not free when I attached the label provided under separate cover the following day and it was rejected at the Post Office.No 2. I subsequently had to pay £9.95 tracked to return just one item from the order. The full order cost me £4.95 to deliver initially, despite being well over the threshold at which similar companies would deliver for free. i.e. orders over £100. I reference John Lewis ( orders over £50 ), LK Bennett ( orders over £300), Hobbs ( orders over £150 ) etc. As 3 items from HOfB can  ( and did ) easily cost over £300 I ask again, WHY?No. 3. House of Bruar received my return the following day. Silence.When I emailed to request an update on the status of my return, they told me it took 14 days for a refund. Having returned a parcel to both LK Bennett and John Lewis on the same day, I not only received a notification of receipt from them but got my refund a week sooner. Why does it take House Of Bruar twice as long? Without the tracking, I would have had no idea if they had received it or not.No. 4. SIZING.It’s a mess. I purchased three skirts over several orders. A long kilt in size 18, a wrap skirt in size 18 an A line skirt in size 20. ( I should say that I’m a consistent size 16 across all of the above mentioned stores. A pair of trouser size 16 purchased previously from HOfB were too small but I gave them to a friend.)The kilt was tight and did up on the last belt hole. The wrap around skirt was enormous on waist and hips, ( even after Xmas festivities I could have jumped in and out of it) and I struggled to do up the size 20 A line skirt zip. The waist was very tight.When I pointed out in an email to customer services this lucky dip/random approach to sizing, I was told all the sizes/ measurements were available under each item description. But I’m confused. Are they trying to tell me a size 20 measurements are smaller than a size 16/18? What’s the point in giving a garment a size in that case? No 5. How is a customer supposed to buy with confidence if there is this random sizing? It means IN EVERY INSTANCE you WILL have to pay just to try on, if you purchase from this company online. To deliver and subsequently send back. Make sure you pay for tracking or the rollercoaster ride that is buying from this company will only just have begun.I made all these points to customer services in three emails. They chose to ignore and cherry pick which queries they answered. And it goes without saying, when I asked to be refunded for my return costs, I was ignored. I was told they’d pass on my comments and I’ve waited to be contacted before leaving this feedback. I haven’t been. I feel like they prevaricate and make the customer jump through hoops UNTIL THEY WEAR THEM DOWN. How is this service?I would say buyer beware. I won’t be buying from them again. I was also unable to use both e vouchers I’d received as Christmas gifts on the ONE order and had to buy the two items separately and …YES YOU’VE GUESSED IT….. pay the outmoded delivery of £4.95 TWICE. Each item cost around £150! Again, well over other companies free delivery threshold.I thought at least I’d get that money back, when I questioned why but Customer services ignored this issue and had the cheek to end their email with “if you have any further queries, please don’t hesitate to contact us.”But i have run out of patience and energy trying to deal with all this. Easier never to shop with them again. I HOPE IF YOU DO, YOU ARE NOW BETTER INFORMED HAVING READ THIS REVIEW. I’M NOT ALONE IN MY COMMENTS. SEE OTHER ONE STAR REVIEWS. SAME ISSUES. GOOD LUCK.

Information: Scottish country clothing specialists the House of Bruar enjoy a unique reputation for quality that extends throughout our clothing, produce and art collections.
Review Text: Ordered a food hamper to be despatched on the 8th of December 2023 which it was. On checking the tracking number it has sat at the Post Office sorting office since then. Called them on the 15th promised a call back, nothing happened. Called on the 18th twice promised a call back nothing received. Left message on their automated phone service which promises a call back by close of business, nothing received. Call again this morning the 19th, told by the person who answered the phone, Richard, all he could do is send another request to get a sales person to call me back. The same thing the other operatives said they would do and nothing happens. I ask how I can escalate my complaint, told there was no way he could do this only send another request for the sales team to call me back. He said they where very busy....no wonder if this is the standard of service they offer. Still not had a call back. 3 working days have now passed since my first call. Unacceptable. They just do not care once they have your money.

Information: Scottish country clothing specialists the House of Bruar enjoy a unique reputation for quality that extends throughout our clothing, produce and art collections.
Review Text: Returned my parcel via special delivery tracked and recorded i know they received it next day as I have tracking number. .  I paid £12.50 as the goods are worth over £500.  I now note they have a 14 days return before they return your money which is shocking to hold peoples money for so long especially at this time as I don’t have the money for another present until I receive my refund.  I will not be buying again with this experience so beware.  Today I have received my refund I am happy with this and can’t fault my e experience with House of Bruar thank you.

Review Text: Have been a customer for a long time. Had a misfortune to order a coat. After 2 weeks - silence. Contacted customer service - dispatch was delayed. Asked to wait. 3rd week - nothing. Then promised it would come by a special delivery. Didnt happen. Had to call 18 times - every time empty promises. Arrived at the end so late i no longer needed it and asked to be sent return labels. Promised these would arrive asap by 3 different advisors. Never arrived. They messed me about at 9 months pregnant to the point i dont want to give them any more of my custom. Rude, unapologetic and no concept of listening. Now battling to get my postage back!!!! Few days away from giving birth. Spend your money where your custom is appreciated and where ordering online does not cause an episode of hypertension.

Review Title: Can not do a search for:
Information: Scottish country clothing specialists the House of Bruar enjoy a unique reputation for quality that extends throughout our clothing, produce and art collections.
Review Text: Can not do a search for:Cruelty free clothing IE knitwearVeganSyntheticsI came across this store via Google when I saw a reasonably priced jacket that was 100% made from cruelty free materials. Which is as it should be in a civilised society. This is the end of 2023 not a time period of unevolved ignorance and immoral unethical behaviours. How is it classy to wear an animal parts and pay into extremely cruel practices!?If you can manage without these byproducts and make a jacket that can stand up to the elements of UK weather then you have shown you do not need to make a profit out of horrific cruelty bestowed upon sentient beings.What does it say about people who take the lives of others for self gratification when they have their own and wouldn't want to suffer the same fate! If you can peddle these items of cruelty and pay for and wear these items of cruelty without even consider the pain and the screams and fear. Or what you are even wearing or paying into what does that say about you!?I spoke to customer service and they said it's really just what they sell and make a profit on. They said that's just the nature of their business. Wow! Completely unevolved, devoid of any morales and exstreamly conditioned and greedy.Why would anyone want to wear something that is itchy! Just because they deem it to represent class. Just because it was once they only option many centuries ago and the royals sport cruelty items in the tabloids while out killing wildlife in a tweed jacket. It's is a sad mentality that sees life through a mind conditioned in this way. Like you feel you have to go and shoot a few birds out of the sky or kill a fox to be a better quality of person than everyone else. How does someone who believes they are more intelligent than the rest and better turned out even justify this flawed way of thinking!Educate yourselves on the wool industries. Google "is there cruelty in the wool industries? Search each time of wool. PETA has a video showing the wool industries practices and how sheep are punched in the face in order to keep them still because staff are trying to shear for profit not the sheep's wellbeing and turnover is high. Sheep indure deep cuts and are stitched on the spot without anesthetic. Check out the rape rack and tail docking.Have a look at cashmere and the screaming rabbits.Have a look at the industries for all these wools and ask yourself what's wrong with synthetics? They are warm, durable and soft. You can throw them in the washing machine time and time again. More importantly they can't be marked up in price and do not cause suffering.Oh look! I just read a review from someone who purchased a sheep's skin to step out in! How about some nose bones in the accessory section and maybe a spear. A sentient being had that skin cut from their body.

Review Title: I placed my order on 10th November and…
Information: Scottish country clothing specialists the House of Bruar enjoy a unique reputation for quality that extends throughout our clothing, produce and art collections.
Review Text: I placed my order on 10th November and received an email informing me that it had been dispatched on 11th November. It is now 20th November and have not received my order. I have telephoned you on two occasions and on the second occasion it transpired that the courier for my order was supposed to be Evri but it has been collected by Royal Mail. I have received a card from Royal Mail and paid £7 because the vendor hadn't paid the postage. I am hoping that my order will arrive tomorrow, the 21st November but who knows? If it arrives I will have to telephone you again to request the £ 7 be refunded, which I am sure will happen but I have had to do all the telephoning and organisation. Why do H of B not choose one courier and stick with them to avoid these kind of mistakes.

Information: Scottish country clothing specialists the House of Bruar enjoy a unique reputation for quality that extends throughout our clothing, produce and art collections.
Review Text: I saw an offer in the Saturday Telegraph offering  £50 off ladies cashmere jumpers.  I always order a new cashmere jumper each year so I thought this was a good offer from a reputable company at an amazing price of £70. Its a funny sort of cashmere is all i can say - the label says 100% cashmere but it must be the lowest inferior grade of cashmere possible.  It is rough to the touch, very very thin (in fact its virtually see-through. nothing like my other jumpers. The jumpers fit is also not right, I am size 10-12 so I ordered a medium which only just fits.   I haven't sent it back because £8 return fee is terrible so I decided to wear it as an under jumper during the winter.  Never again will I order from this company. I should have stuck to M&S roll neck cashmere  jumpers - the quality and fit is superb and compared to House of Bruar worth every penny!!!

Information: Scottish country clothing specialists the House of Bruar enjoy a unique reputation for quality that extends throughout our clothing, produce and art collections.
Review Text: I’ve never ordered from House of Bruar before and I won’t be again. I saw an offer in the Saturday edition of the Daily Mail offering readers £50 off ladies cashmere jumpers of a certain style and make. My wife was wanting a cashmere jumper so thought it a good offer. The jumper therefore reduced from £120 to £70. The order went fine and the jumper arrived. It was a beautiful colour with some attractive buttons down the back and on the sleeves, but that’s where the compliments end. Cashmere??  It said so on the label, 100% cashmere, so it had to be of course, but it must have been the lowest grade of cashmere, as it was rough to the touch and felt more like lambs wool. It was very thin as well. Cashmere is renowned for it’s softness and luxury feel, that is what you’re paying for. Not here, you’re not. The jumper fit was also off. Fitted everywhere apart from the bottom trim, which was swinging in the wind and not at all flattering. We sent the jumper straight back, miffed that it had cost my wife £13 for the privilege of trying on their below standard goods. £5 delivery and £8 return postage, to insure the contents inside. Never again will I order from this company, the adage seems to be correct here, if something seems too good to be true, it’s usually the case. You live and learn as they say.

Review Title: Customer care / administration hopeless totally disorganised
Information: Scottish country clothing specialists the House of Bruar enjoy a unique reputation for quality that extends throughout our clothing, produce and art collections.
Review Text: I had purchased previously two lovely waistcoats - no problem.  In September I ordered three polo necks.  The first was faulty so didn't try the other two on.  I sent this email: "Dear Sirs,I received my polonecks and am very disappointed.  I tried on the emerald one and trying to pull the neck part over my head I was concerned that the stitching would break as it was so tight.  Once on I felt I was being choked by the neck, so immediately removed it and am returning it with the two others that I have not tried on because I assume they will be the same.  I have been wearing polonecks since I was 14, and they were very popular in the early 70s when I had many colours.  My weight is 10st 9lbs and my height is 5ft 5inches.   If all your polonecks have been made so small at the neck I would think you will have a lot returned. I would also draw your attention to the fact that the neck part of the item was not attached correctly to the body part you will see they did a tuck at the back which is not professional sewing.  Also I noted the very scratchy labels which I would have had to remove and wondered if in doing so I would actually make holes in my item so all in all a poor quality item. Lastly on the back of your document with the return label it says:"Returns - Please see overleaf for information on how to return or exchange your items."Can you tell me what I should have seen? thanks. If you believe that the emerald item was a batch below standard and that your others fit comfortably then please let me know and I might try ordering again, but I think you need to do a thorough examination. "I then had to wait for them to send me a postage label to return.  I returned all three items via Royal Mail tracked.  When I saw that the parcel had been delivered (received by HofB ) I rang them.  First they told me that they had not received it, when I queried the parcel tracking number they conceded they were looking at a wrong number and that they had received my parcel and that I would be credited and that it could take 14 days!  Yesterday I got an email saying they were crediting me for ONE polo neck.  So they have received  THREE and don't even have a system for checking in 3. On top of this mess I wrote to H of B in December last year informing them of my change of address.  They obviously keep two databases or they don't inform the company sending out their brochures of any changes.  I have since December received orders delivered correctly to my current home, but they continue to deliver brochures to my old address despite more emails since December last year.  My redirection runs out this month (paid for 12 months) and just got another brochure.  The time I have to spend on trying them to remove my old address is incredible.  So in summary if you order and you want to return or you move beware that you will be spending a lot of your life trying to get this company to put things right.

Information: Scottish country clothing specialists the House of Bruar enjoy a unique reputation for quality that extends throughout our clothing, produce and art collections.
Review Text: Item ordered was good quality but two sizes too small. Don’t know if it was mis-sized or not but unusual to find that with their stock. Usually buy direct from store but online for the first time and never again. It arrived too late for when I needed it so was going back anyway. Disappointed with the length of time for delivery as it was in stock when I ordered. In this day and age for items over a certain cost, free delivery is widely available, but not with this company. I wouldn’t have minded paying the £4.95 but it took 8 days to arrive, shocking!!  Expensive amount to pay for that delivery time and I’m only an hour and a half away from them!  What really got me though was that they proudly boast online about free international delivery!  Wow, looks like UK customer charges are making up for some of that and when I raised it with them they were non apologetic. All down to customs regulations apparently, so that’s all there is to it. Nothing offered to us and don't bother complaining about it either was the feeling I got from their reaction. To top it all, a charge for returns too and I had to pay £3.95 for the pleasure. So nearly £9.00 for an item I can’t use. Free delivery, free returns is very common with the many quality companies I shop with across a wide range of quality merchandise. The surprising thing is when the item was late, I ordered something similar from another retailer and it arrived two days before the H of B item. It was free delivery and free returns. It fitted perfectly so no return needed. Nope I won’t be buying again from H of B either in their store or online. Not a good experience at all and comparable quality and choice, better service and value is out there and that’s where I went and got it. Extremely disappointed.I returned the item and not a squeak for over two weeks whether received or not. I phoned to check and told it was just being processed and could take up to 14 days to be refunded from then  That will be over 28 days. I don’t disagree that this company can provide quality stock but at the prices it should. The issue I have is that if you encounter anything around problems of delivery times and costs, returns etc then they have an extremely poor quality of customer service and other reviews point to that too. Beware then, all fine, if all fine!  Anything out of the ordinary, then The House of Bruar is not interested. Quality customer service plays no part in their transaction with you.Finally got my refund. It only took 21 days from the date of return. No idea why it takes so long in this digital age for this company to refund customers’ money. They didn’t have the courtesy to tell me. My opinion is that they must be in some kind of trouble. No staff to process orders, no staff to arrange timely deliveries that you’ve already paid for, no staff to process returns in a timely fashion, no staff to process refunds, no staff in their ‘customer service department’ to communicate with customers on the progress of orders, returns or refunds, clearly no effective digital systems in use or no staff to utilise them. Yes I’m afraid it looks to me that The House of Bruar is lacking in the fundamental investment in staff that a successful business needs in this day and age of online shopping. Not the case?  Why is their customer service so bad then?  Be aware, I got my money back, if they’re in trouble, others in the future might not.

Review Title: Slow Delivery…Slower refund…if ever I get my money!!
Information: Scottish country clothing specialists the House of Bruar enjoy a unique reputation for quality that extends throughout our clothing, produce and art collections.
Review Text: I purchased a lovely rain coat and matching hat which were described as Black-watch tartan and a knee high pair of leather boots.The coat and hat were so dark, I thought they had sent me a black outfit… nothing like the colour shown on the web or catalogue.  The leather boots were faulty with a very wrinkled tongue behind the laces, which was extremely uncomfortable and the leather too stiff to soften.I returned all 3 items asking for a refund of £554.90 (inc delivery). they were delivered and accepted back at the company on 01/09/23 and a tracked photo taken.I emailed customer services on 11/09/23 requesting when I would receive my refund?…£274.95 was deposited in my bank later that day on 11/0923  Another email reminding them I had returned a pair of faulty boots, requesting when I would receive my £275.00.  I was informed they were with the Returns Team on 15/09/23 and were being dealt with.Another 2 more emails to customer services reminding them I wanted a refund and the result of the inspection is not my concern.  Still NO refund!I thought this company was a reputable organisation with good quality, albeit pricey goods but it seems to me they are out of their depth, slow delivery, appalling refund procedure.Lost More than They Gained…Extremely Disappointed by them deciding I will never use them again.

Review Text: I placed an order on Monday 28th August and was notified it had been dispatched by 48 hour delivery on Tuesday 29th August. I’d always heard good things but this has been one of the worst online shopping experiences I’ve ever had. Extremely frustrated and disappointed.

The other item was sized but didn’t mention that it was a shorter fit jumper and again no sizing.It won’t stop me ordering again but I will be more cautious and ask before I order if sizing isn’t obvious. Review Title: Disappointed with shoes and returns process
Information: Scottish country clothing specialists the House of Bruar enjoy a unique reputation for quality that extends throughout our clothing, produce and art collections.
Review Text: Disappointed that the shoes had obviously already been tried on and the toes looked grubby (pale coloured fabric upper). Only one shoe had a card insert to protect the shape. I paid both delivery and return postage charges for less than satisfactory goods . I feel I should have had postage charge refunded.   I’m unlikely to make further purchases because of the risk. My previous purchase had been satisfactory.

Information: Scottish country clothing specialists the House of Bruar enjoy a unique reputation for quality that extends throughout our clothing, produce and art collections.
Review Text: The jacket I ordered was well packaged & was a nice jacket. Sadly, it did not suit me so returned. When ordering I was lucky to be able to use a free delivery discount code. I had not realised - my fault- that I was responsible for the cost of the return. To return via Royal Mail it would have cost me over £11for postage & insurance. To charge for both delivery & for returns is not acceptable & a bit greedy. I don’t use any other retail business who does this. For this reason I shall not shop at House of Bruar in future. I ended up paying approx £4.50 to send the parcel back via Yodel who have an arrangement with House of Bruar for returns.

I am a modern day apple shape or man shape... ie waist and hip nearer same inches. Usually I buy trousers with lots of elastane so that they fit on the waist and around the hips. ..but I've always wanted moleskin jeans in olive colour.... but cut did not fit from House of Bruar....had to send back with refund😢 I'm a 35" waist  & a 40inch hip. I hope you can help in the future... Many thanks H J

Review Title: In January I purchased 3 Marino wool…
Information: Scottish country clothing specialists the House of Bruar enjoy a unique reputation for quality that extends throughout our clothing, produce and art collections.
Review Text: In January I purchased 3 Marino wool crew necked jumpers 2 have each been laundered twice1 not  at all but has been worn The jumpers have become pilled  and linted and look as though they have been worn day and night for a year.I contacted customer services via the online chat to be told that I could purchase a tool to use on the jumpers to remove the pilling.I am happy to provide photographs  of the jumpers  This tool cost between£12 and £25 and carry a warning that they can snag the material. I have purchased Marino wool  jumpers before  from other companies in fact I have one that is at least 10 years old and is in better condition than these. I was told I could return the jumpers for their opinion at my own expense and they were unable to give me prepaid return I have estimated on weighing them it would be about £10.00 postage I am unsubscribing from the House of Bruar and will never purchase from them again.

Information: Scottish country clothing specialists the House of Bruar enjoy a unique reputation for quality that extends throughout our clothing, produce and art collections.
Review Text: I ordered a couple of dresses, one of them arrived with a stain... I emailed them with a photo, never received a response, then I opened the online chat and they told me to email for a free return label (mind you, I still have not received a response to the email). So best they could offer was the free return label (not reimbursing my original delivery fee), which I would then need to print and post myself, wasting my time, not to mention the time already wasted to place and order and waiting for the dress. This is not the customer service you would expect from a UK company. They portray themselves as high quality clothing, etc, but they will never be that with this sort of customer service. I work myself at the hospitality industry and this is just plainly showing no respect for their customer or their time. Also in general, who sends stained clothes that are supposed to be new? Do not recommend.

Review Title: First purchase from House of Bruar
Information: Scottish country clothing specialists the House of Bruar enjoy a unique reputation for quality that extends throughout our clothing, produce and art collections.
Review Text: First purchase from House of Bruar, shopping for a 60th Birthday gift for my Brother in Law. The Item I chose was the patchwork Harris Tweed Flat Cap, which was beautiful when it arrived and loved by the recipient. I was however, disappointed to see that there was no Gift Wrap Service on offer. I opened an online Chat to enquire if the Cap  would arrive in a Branded Box - only to be told by the "Chat Assistant" that he did not know. Not very helpful. The Cap was not presented in a Branded Box, just in a cellophane packet, which was quite disappointing. I would have been happy to pay extra, for the presentation to match the quality of the product. I upgraded the postage to a next day service - and delivery was duly received within the timeframe.

Review Title: A Christmas hamper ordered for a family…
Information: Scottish country clothing specialists the House of Bruar enjoy a unique reputation for quality that extends throughout our clothing, produce and art collections.
Review Text: A Christmas hamper ordered for a family member was never delivered. Excuses given included lost in postal system and when returned to The House of Bruar it went unnoticed for many weeks.  After about 3 months I got an apologetic letter with confirmation of a refund. I wrote back expressing my disappointment and asked why this present had gone missing for many months.  Then they gave a woeful list of reasons including blaming the postal service and that their internal process had not picked this issue up and offered to send the hamper with a letter of apology 'free of charge'.  While this offer was the least they could do all this time after Christmas it did not demonstrate what a quality (read expensive) and service driven company they claim to be. I will not be recommending this company as this level of service was abysmal.

Review Text: I have used this company on many occasions and am impressed with the service and quality of its products - however I can only give three stars for the mittens as I was disappointed with them . Bought them as present for my daughter but they were much thinner than I anticipated and the many seams and therefore stitching made them quite tight - in fact one was smaller than the other. I appreciate the natural product means every mitten is individual but the turn back “cuffs”were different depths so overall I wasn’t happy with them and returned them for a refund.

Information: Scottish country clothing specialists the House of Bruar enjoy a unique reputation for quality that extends throughout our clothing, produce and art collections.
Review Text: One star because the website makes you choose at least 1.Where do I start. Ordered a number of shirts from this outfit. Received confirmation of the order but no despatch confirmation. Waited for 4 days and phoned up. Eventually the phone was picked but was told the order hadn't been processed yet. Received an email telling me the order has been despatched and would be with me in 48hrs......Well that came and went and I am still waiting. So I rang them up. The person I spoke to could of been from the 19th Century... Told me that the order hadn't been delivered because my house was "Inaccessible?!!!!!!! What a gem....... Asked for a full refund.....and of course she couldn't process this as it wasn't her job.... and she couldn't transfer me because "THEY DON'T HAVE THE FACILITY TO TRANSFER ANYONE BECAUSE THEY DON'T HAVE THE CUSTOMER SERVICE NUMBER." Reminded her that this was in fact the 21st Century and this was a normal service to which she replied that "THEY DON'T HAVE THE FACILITY TO TRANSFER ANYONE BECAUSE THEY DON'T HAVE THE CUSTOMER SERVICE NUMBER." I would recommend to anyone not to use this organisation they don't care about customers and are not worthy are your business.

Information: Scottish country clothing specialists the House of Bruar enjoy a unique reputation for quality that extends throughout our clothing, produce and art collections.
Review Text: I ordered goods from HofB on 19 Dec, 22 and paid £7.95 for Royal Mail Special delivery before Xmas. On 21 Dec I followed a the royal Mail tracking system and advised me that it had been delivered and showing a signature( not mine as it wasn't delivered). I spoke to HofB on 22 Dec who said they would get back to me but only did so on 27th Dec when they said they would check it with Royal Mail and I never heard anymore from them. Yesterday 5 January, Royal Mail delivered the goods to me 15 days after I had ordered it and paid special delivery. When I spoke with House of Bruar todayI requested a refund on the delivery as  I know they are insured for it. The representative said she would offer me £3.95 nit the £7.95 as I would have had to pay for the normal delivery. No apology for the fact that the goods bought as a xmas present didn't arrive. It didn't seem that they  made any effort to chase Royal mail. Poor customer service and lack of concern about my experience . And no apology. Had they chased Royal Mail on 22nd, we had been advised that Royal Mail could have tracked exactly where the package was , as it had been wrongly delivered. But no ownership from HofB, no concern about my experience.

Information: Scottish country clothing specialists the House of Bruar enjoy a unique reputation for quality that extends throughout our clothing, produce and art collections.
Review Text: Men's wool overshirt: it's wool so that's good. But the good ends there. For the price, even reduced, the cut is poor. With correct chest size measurements ordered, and a t-shirt plus long sleeve baselayer top worn, the sleeves are at least an inch too short. Its meant to be an over shirt. So ought to accommodate more clothing layers underneath which would make the arms seem even shorter.  The bottom hem cut is as for a standard shirt i.e.  drops at front and back, curves up at sides. But the cut at the sides rises quite high, again for an over shirt this does make it look a bit weird. I already own two over shirts which do as described, and so fit "OVER" other clothing and provide decent cover. I sent the overshirt back. We obviously differ on our understanding of what an overshirt is and how it should fit.

Review Text: On the 7th Dec my mother phoned and ordered and paid for a Luxury Hamper which was to be delivered on 21st Dec but it did not arrive, so today 22nd Dec she phoned to enquire about it and was told it had not been sent, but they did have all the order details and said it must  have been a computer error (operated by a human).As this was a Christmas gift which was being delivered to the recipient, my mother feels totally let down and embarrassed as it is too late to order another. Information: Scottish country clothing specialists the House of Bruar enjoy a unique reputation for quality that extends throughout our clothing, produce and art collections.
Review Text: 3 Christmas hampers ordered and email received telling me they'd been despatched via ParcelForce.  None of the links worked over the next four days - but I feel this was probably NOT Bruar's fault as the postal strikes were on.  However, what was their fault is that they failed to add two out of the three Christmas gift messages at all (although the order confirmation showed them correctly) and the one they did manage was delivered to the wrong person.  So two recipients had no idea who their hamper was from and the third had a nice message, just not to them.    Unable to get any response from their email addresses, hence 2* rather than the 3* it possibly merited.

Review Title: THE WORSE EXPERIANCE ever I had
Information: Scottish country clothing specialists the House of Bruar enjoy a unique reputation for quality that extends throughout our clothing, produce and art collections.
Review Text: THE WORSE EXPERIANCE ever I had, trying  to place an order.I can not believe how this company works. I can not even explain my anger in this short massage. who ever is the owner of this poor company he or she should wake up and see this otherwise this company will definitely go down very soon if there service remain the same.I placed my order on the 27 of November for delivery with in 4 days , I had to phone the company 8 times, to try and get confirmation as to when it would arrive at its intended destination , they either gave me excuses, (not yet despatched)  or passed me on to another department.In the end after two weeks of providing me with false information I had no option but to cancel the order from F&M My advise to you don't waste your time with this company. life is too short, Happy Christmas

Information: Scottish country clothing specialists the House of Bruar enjoy a unique reputation for quality that extends throughout our clothing, produce and art collections.
Review Text: The telephone order service was excellent.  There was very little waiting time to get a customer service person.  I have placed two separate orders in December and each time the person processing the phone order was delightful to deal with. Usually I visit the House of Bruar  in person when I return to Scotland where I grew up so this was the first time I had used the phone order service.  It was lovely to hear the Scottish accents! The delivery came within a few days and I am very pleased with the quality of the items I ordered ((the lovely warm boucle coat and two oversized very soft wool shirts in oatmeal and taupe colours.)   I think your catalogues are beautifully produced and the scenic backdrops make me feel very nostalgic.  The reproduction of the colours was very accurate (unlike many catalogues.)    I also think prices are very reasonable for the quality of the clothing.With warm regards, A very happy customer.

The cardigans bought from you (money correctly taken from my account and delivered correctly to my mother) great but there was no returns form for one of them inside. And I have no receipts to show the purchase.  As customer number and also purchase number is on front of cardboard box I imagine this will eventually be sorted out but all this is very tedious.  Ofcourse I rang yesterday hoping to request a  returns form but Ofcourse nobody picked up.

Review Title: Receiving unwanted postal mailings and impossible to get removed
Information: Scottish country clothing specialists the House of Bruar enjoy a unique reputation for quality that extends throughout our clothing, produce and art collections.
Review Text: This company buy mailing lists from other companies so you end up getting postal mailings from them, even though you’ve never heard of them before, have never ordered anything from them and don’t wish to do so. I think this is a very underhand practice. Once you are on their list of addresses obtained via a third-party, it’s very difficult to get removed. They gave me the name of the third-party company to request removal, which I did. I first received a mailing from them in August this year and, now again, in November. It’s just unacceptable.

Information: Scottish country clothing specialists the House of Bruar enjoy a unique reputation for quality that extends throughout our clothing, produce and art collections.
Review Text: Delivery a disaster.  Still unable to discuss properly with HofB.  Parcelforce 3 times said they had called and I was home, which was not true.  Also said they had left a card, which they had not.  On the 4th attempt the driver checked through all the parcels in the van to find the address on the package.  It was not on their electronic device so no address showing.  She showed me the blank space on the device.    Her experience is that BofB and one or two other large companies often do not enter full details onto their form so the drivers are sent out without electronic directions.  They have little or no time to check through the hundreds of parcels in their van to find the missing address.  I told HofB repeatedly I thought this was the problem but redelivery was requested with the same result.  I could do nothing myself without the missing nondelivery card.  I would still be waiting home now if one bright delivery lady had not gone the second mile and taken time to search the actual parcels in the van to find the address.  I have requested a telephone call from HofB Mail Order so I can explain the problem.Hopefully someone will ring me next week. Lovely clothes, so very sad I don't feel I can order from them again.

Review Text: I have always been pleased with House of Bruar when ordering and receiving goods but must write particularly about some exceptional customer service. I own several of their lambswool jumpers which always come with a small amount of matching wool for any repairs (a point in their favour already.) However, when I made a hole in my green jumper it was the only colour wool that I couldn't find. I emailed customer services, hoping that they would send me another piece, willing to pay for it if necessary. Samantha not only replied to each of my emails within a day, she tracked my previous orders to establish the exact colour green required. This is no longer a colour option for my type of jumper but she still managed to source an identical colour and send it, with a handwritten note, free of charge within three days of my original enquiry. I am very impressed and extremely grateful.

Scottish country clothing specialists the House of Bruar enjoy a unique reputation for quality that extends throughout our clothing, produce and art collections.
Review Text: For many years we have stopped for food at the House of Bruar either travelling south or north.On a recent holiday to the south of Scotland, we dropped in to the House of Bruar for breakfast.  We were most disappointed in that by the time we picked up our food, ordered tea and coffee, paid and collected cutlery etc our food was cold.On the way home after our holiday, we stopped for a meal.  Again, by the time we queued with our food, a stream of people ahead of us, with only one member of staff to make teas/coffees and take our payment, our food was cold by the time we sat down.  A kind member of staff reheated it for us….this was twice it had been placed under heat!  When the food is first dished up, it’s then placed under heat to be re-heated!In recent years more tables have been added to the restaurant, but no changes seem to have been made to cope with the added volume of footfall.  The cost to eat in the restaurant is pricey for food which is cold before it can be eaten.Many other similar facilities we have visited offer a service whereby food is ordered and paid for, then served to the customers table from the kitchen, and it’s hot.  Brodie Countryfare and Dalmore Farm in Alness to name two.  The service we recently received on two separate days at Bruar has made us consider taking our future custom to Bankfoot when travelling, unless we know that customers are listened to and changes considered.

Review Text: Items were exactly what I wanted and as ordered. The order arrived by post within 4 days so that was remarkably quick considering there was a postal strike on one of the days! Thank you very much Bruar.

Information: Scottish country clothing specialists the House of Bruar enjoy a unique reputation for quality that extends throughout our clothing, produce and art collections.
Review Text: Was longing to buy a kilt for some time, but could never find the perfect one with right length and girth! - I am a chubby 5’2”. I could have a bespoke kilt made but that would cost too much. Then Bruar’s new autumn catalogue arrived with the perfect kilt advertised, but hey ho! it was just a tad too expensive. Imagine my delight when a few days later I received a letter from Bruars offering me a discount on any purchase AND free postage. This was an offer I couldn’t refuse. So I went ahead with the kilt and am thrilled with it. Perfect material, perfect size and just what I had wanted! Thank you Bruar. You have one exceptionally happy customer here. I SO appreciate your offer.

Information: Scottish country clothing specialists the House of Bruar enjoy a unique reputation for quality that extends throughout our clothing, produce and art collections.
Review Text: Goods exactly as described - excellent quality!

Information: Scottish country clothing specialists the House of Bruar enjoy a unique reputation for quality that extends throughout our clothing, produce and art collections.
Review Text: Ordered 4 pairs of the men's mercerised cotton socks size 7-9.  Disappointed with them as too big by an inch or so for a size 7.  Also size varied from colour to colour.  One of the four pairs was just about OK and I have kept them.  The other three I have sent to a relative with bigger feet!  The quality wasn't that good either and not worth £8.95 a pair.  As there are no free returns and I had to undo the socks to try them on and therefore the packaging had been disturbed and as a refund was subject to a review and not a no quibble refund I thought I would pass them on, as above.  Suggest ordering one pair at a time unless your foot size is 8 or 9.

Review Text: I only bought one item from The House of Bruar in the early part of this year. It was a Liberty print cotton  skirt. The material was thin, unlined, see through and poor value for money. Then came the letter, attached with promise of FREE DELIVERY. I did not expect such a marketing strategy from The House of Bruar. You're Tops. No other retailer does it.

The whole experience is so painful that one should think hundred  times before even thinking of placing any order with them. You click order, you get punished. They don’t take any ownership.

Review Text: I was  pleased with the fabric and style of the garments but all were too small.The size charts vary depending on the garment. Also when I phoned to ask how to obtain the correct size I was told to measure across the bust on a t- shirt I already have which fits perfectly and although it is a size 14 it is different by 2 inches from my bust measurment  so that advice was of no help..I always buy a 14/16 size but  according to your size chart I need an 18 size with one garment and a 44 with another. I was going to exchange the items and return  to the store with Collect plus but neither of thestores on their web site exist.I then phoned over and over again the numbers on the letter and order form 0345 236 0111 and 0345 136 0111 only to hear a message  that tthe numbers were not recognised and  got through by phoning the overseas number.Other mail order firms I have used offer free returns with Hermes or Evri. Now I have to pay the postage at the post officeIt is such a shame as I very much liked the style and fabric of the three items but do not want to have to keep paying to return garments so decided to ask for a refund rather than an exchange  I have wasted a whole afternoonI will not be purchasing anything from House of Bruar in the future

Information: Scottish country clothing specialists the House of Bruar enjoy a unique reputation for quality that extends throughout our clothing, produce and art collections.
Review Text: As a first time purchaser from Bruars i had very high hopes. I originate from Aberdeen and always do try to support family businesses.However your size scale is very limited - I bought the Rose Denim Floral jacket as i thought it was beautiful.  It was but for an S it was huge. I have sadly had to return it awaiting refund.  Feedback - you have to consider petite or smaller people - 5ft 1" and 47kilos in my case. Most places now do an XS or an 6./8 you seem to do neither. You should also consider your returns policy - say, pay extra £1 up front to be used for return if needed. If not you have gained £1 and the customer happy to keep. To have to pay either £7 or £4 to return at the Post Office really was a double whammy for me. So sadly, i will not be rushing back.

Information: Scottish country clothing specialists the House of Bruar enjoy a unique reputation for quality that extends throughout our clothing, produce and art collections.
Review Text: I bought a men's mackintosh coat from House of Bruar's own brand. I'd tried the mac on in House of Bruar shop itself, and while I hadn't bought the jacket for rainy days (more as a light weight summer jacket) it wasn't clear whether the mac was just one of those fashion macs that can't tolerate a drop of water. I had a good discussion with a member of staff, though he admitted to not being able to confirm how the jacket would respond in light rain, and suggested I take a bit more time to think about it, then order online. So that's what I did. I'm very pleased with the jacket, which arrived very quickly indeed. I can also confirm that there is a water-repellent coating on the material, and while this may wear off eventually, it seems that the manufacturer had considered the possibility that the wearer might occasionally get caught out in the rain! On the whole, an excellent purchasing experience, which has always been my experience with House of Bruar.

Information: Scottish country clothing specialists the House of Bruar enjoy a unique reputation for quality that extends throughout our clothing, produce and art collections.
Review Text: Ordered food items for my husband's birthday.  Checked website before placing the order and it said order before 12 for next day delivery.  After placing the order it said that due to stock take there would be a delay delivering orders.  Telephoned customer service to query this and see if my items could arrive in time and was met with a patronising person who told me I should order before 11 a.m. and even then it wouldn't usually be dispatched until the following day so there is effectively no next day delivery service for food.  She denied that the website said order before 12 and acted as though she could not care less about my order or predicament and refused to put me through to someone else.  This shop sell luxury goods but certainly do not have luxury customer service to match.

Information: Scottish country clothing specialists the House of Bruar enjoy a unique reputation for quality that extends throughout our clothing, produce and art collections.
Review Text: Generally good. Wide selection of most items of ladies clothing, sufficient to suit many but the sizing is not too accurate. Selling different brands it possibly isn't an option to standardise sizes but it would help to have all in UK 8 ,10,12 etc as continental 38,40,42 etc are NOT the same in all European countries. e.g. a German 46 is more like our 20 but a Portuguese 46 is an 18 - France is different again! 40 years working in the EU has taught me to be wary of sizing. House of Bruar evidently isn't aware of these differences.

Review Text: Never used this company before but found this website good and with interesting stock. But I got there looking for a jacket for my wife that was sold out else where. However what arrived was the same brand of jacket but with a bright pink chest logo and trim, not what my wife wanted, and not even one of the options shown on their web site. I checked the page again when this pink version arrived, its still showing the light blue logo we wanted and the pink trim wasn't even one of their options. Returned for refund using the attached sticky label and re-seal pack it arrived in, refund process is all very easy, so just waiting for my refund now, minus the cost I paid for delivery, and the cost of sending it back.

Review Title: The Stornoway coat is made of lovely…
Information: Scottish country clothing specialists the House of Bruar enjoy a unique reputation for quality that extends throughout our clothing, produce and art collections.
Review Text: The Stornoway coat is made of lovely tweed and I am very happy with my purchase overall.  I would have preferred if the collar lay flatter against the front of the coat, as it tends to stand out slightly, perhaps due to inadequate pressing? I am hoping that when I first get the coat dry cleaned, this problem will be resolved.  Secondly, I thought the lining could have fitted better inside the coat, as there is a quite bit of excess fabric overlapping the inside hem of the coat, though not enough to show from the outside.  Lastly, I was not expecting that there would be padding in the shoulders, but this is more a matter of personal preference, and I was able to remove this relatively easily.  Overall, I am happy with the coat and love the beautiful colours in the tweed fabric.  Thank you.

I found you on the Internet and was not impressed with other offerings, Bruar I know has a reputation that cannot be improved upon.Again many thannks,  I have one question, Why oh Why do you not make jumpers for women in plain, soft and gentle colours, I have devoured our enclosed brochure and there was nothing there that I wanted - SHAME.

Information: Scottish country clothing specialists the House of Bruar enjoy a unique reputation for quality that extends throughout our clothing, produce and art collections.
Review Text: I completely recommend The House of Bruar.   Very pleasant and efficient staff and the quality of goods supplied by them is very high. The only criticism I have is that not all items of clothing have detailed sizing. Actual measurements are so important as different makes vary so much. If you have to order two of anything because this detail is missing so you are unsure if it will be the correct fitting there are no free of postage return labels either. In this instance I simply don’t order because it makes such a large amount extra on the cost of the item. In addition, just receiving stock on line almost daily now you cannot order several items to arrive in one parcel. I also note that not all sizes are available and perhaps only one left and it is sheer chance you may get it. This is particularly frustrating if it is something you would really like to have. Sorry for any hurt caused by these remarks but I do find the above observations to be relevant. However, I couldn’t live without being able to shop with the House of Bruar as all my local better class clothes shops have had to close. One is left with the usual high street options who only want to appeal to the mass market .

Review Title: No problem with clothes or website.
Information: Scottish country clothing specialists the House of Bruar enjoy a unique reputation for quality that extends throughout our clothing, produce and art collections.
Review Text: No problem with clothes or website.Delivery…. It would have been so much easier if the parcel could have been  left in a safe place. The sorting office is in the nearest town, so I missed the delivery on Friday… couldn’t pick up till following Tuesday as bank holiday weekend. Pity, as I wanted clothes for weekend.Returns form…. Surely this should be enclosed with the clothes. I have a separate billing  address, so documents go there. This is ok for invoice, but hopeless if I needed to return items. I’m afraid that this has put me off ordering from H of B as it causes too much hassle. Nowadays, there’s so much ordering on line and quick deliveries, that are comparatively easier. This is a shame, as I have been a customer for a long time and have found you very helpful…. not so much now, however, as I have raised this point about the returns in with clothes before.

Review Title: Looking for diversity, courtesy, reliability and efficiency in choosing clothing The House of Bruar leads the way.
Information: Scottish country clothing specialists the House of Bruar enjoy a unique reputation for quality that extends throughout our clothing, produce and art collections.
Review Text: For a reliable and peace of mind ordering service, which is efficient and quick, there is none better than The House of Bruar.  Over the years that I have ordered items of clothing, which have always been of high quality, with items arriving beautifully wrapped in tissue paper, and carefully boxed, making it a special overall experience from the beginning.  When ordering, returning or re-ordering etc., this has been deliberately made simple and easy for customers.  The Customer care service has always been helpful and courteous, which is what to expect from House of Bruar.  House of Bruar shows respect and efficiency, which is hard to find these days, in fact, I consider that there is no other Company that looks after a customer with care and consideration with always a friendly voice or a kind note than The House of Bruar.  This kind of service I have not found anywhere else, and this means that I have no concerns about ordering or returning, if necessary, as I know I will be treated with dignity and respect.  The House of Bruar Catalogue is presented beautifully with clear descriptions of items, showing the materials used, and the clear size availability on offer, in colourful pages of high quality clothing. The House of Bruar Catalogue is a delight to receive,  especially in the knowledge that whatever item(s) you choose and your order, will be handled with care and efficiency.  This is what makes House of Bruar the leader in its field and this has always been the way with the House of Bruar for years and hopefully still more years to come.

Review Text: I would have given 5 stars as the goods and service are normally excellent. However the last tweed jacket, which I bought had to be returned as button holes had not been finished and this meant having to repackage etc... which is a bother. The sales rep was very amenable and apologetic. On the other hand the last cord skirt, which I bought, had only one hanging tag instead of 2. I phoned and gave feedback. I was offered an exchange, but decided just to keep the skirt as it was too much trouble. However I thought that on this occasion the sales rep just could not be bothered. You will see from your records that I do buy a lot from you and am normally delighted.
